body: • An editing error led us to claim that a rise in average temperatures of 2C equates to a rise of 35.6F. This is the fahrenheit equivalent of the actual temperature of 2C; a rise of 2C is a considerably lower 3.6F (Slim down or face ‘brutish’ end, oil companies warned, 6 May, page 29). • The actor who plays “the hopelessly horsey Bridey, the Canadian vulgarian Rex, and the dissipated German soldier Kurt” in York Theatre Royal’s production of Brideshead Revisited is Shuna Snow, not Shuna Shaw as we named her in a review (From guilt to grace as Waugh charts the decline and fall of charming men, 6 May, page 38). • Brecon is in Powys, not Carmarthenshire, where we placed it in a story about a fatality in the town (Soldier dies after being found injured in street, 9 May, page 10, early editions). • Homophone corner: “Certainly, Sunderland fans have been put through the ringer enough not to count any chickens and it could well go down to the final game” (Defoe’s tears of relief lend belief to art of escapology, 9 May, page 6, Sport). • Other recently corrected articles include: Meet the Europeans in Britain’s Brexit heartland British bill of rights could ‘unravel’ constitution, say peers Michael Chabon witnesses ‘grievous injustice’ in occupied territories
